TopicTitle: Green flickering light? Must be Jool or a glitch?

Articles.Content:
Today I was flying the Dragon V2 and found this!

![lEKvmoL.png](http://i.imgur.com/lEKvmoL.png)

Does anybody know what this is?

EDIT: It disappeared when I kept looking at it. This has to be a glitch!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-28T18:05:18Z" title="03/28/2015 06:05  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 28, 2015</time> by KrizzGaming**

It's certainly possible. Even without mods, all planets and stuff are rendered, regardless of where you are. The majority of the time, that render will be a pixel in size (or smaller, so you can't see it at all), but it's definitely possible that what you saw was Jool. Seeing where you were in regards to the Solar System would help prove that answer, though.
Could be either jool or one of the other bodies, ksp can be a bit weird concerning distant objects. You might want to check [thread=98943]this mod[/thread] out.

Hate to break up everyone theories, but that is only Minmus.

It's actually your brain tricking you as you see it green, just zoom in the image and the spot is blue and you can see the object is obviously Minmus

I found out..

I experienced the rarest event ever.. Magic Boulder

> 
> I found out..
> I experienced the rarest event ever.. Magic Boulder

Bull. I want a picture up close or you are a HUGE liar.

> 
> I found out..
> I experienced the rarest event ever.. Magic Boulder

Yeah, about that...

Magic boulder was orbiting Ike and was removed some time ago, sorry to break your dreams
Owen5595 is correct, that is indeed minmus.

> 
> Yeah, about that...
> Magic boulder was orbiting Ike and was removed some time ago, sorry to break your dreams

Its still there when you load up an old version of teh game.....

I actually got my hands on a very old variant of KSP JUST to get that boulder, its the coolest (err was the coolest) easter egg in game, why they removed it is beyond my ability to comprehend.
